/'. Very good : what other divisions of salt-boxes do you
recollect ?
S, They are divided into substantive and pendant,—A
substantive salt-box is that which stands by itself on the table
or dresser, and the pendant is that which hangs by a nail
against the wall.
P. What is the idea of a salt-box l
S. It is that image which the mind conceives of a salt-box
when no salt is present.
P. What is the abstract idea of a sail-box ?
S, It is the idea of a salt-box al stracted from ihe idea of a
box, or of salt, or of a s l-box, r fa box of salt.
